alert.note: Alert for Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 01 at 2:58AM CDT until April 02 at 7:18AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WINSTON COUNTY... At 257 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Ashridge, or 7 miles northeast of Haleyville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Brushy Lake, Moreland, Ashridge, Sipsey River Rec Area, Grayson and western Bankhead National Forest. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
